qas.question: What is it called to check data passed between units?
What is it called when data is being passed?
What is an option  of component interface testing  used while sending message packets?

answers.text: keep a separate log file of data items being passed

qas.question: What is a variation of black-box testing?
What can be used to check the databases passed between units?
What is another name for the data being possessed?

plausible_answers.text: separate log file of data items being passed, often with a timestamp logged to allow analysis of thousands of cases of data passed

qas.question: What is one option for interface integration?

plausible_answers.text: unexpected performance in the next unit

qas.question: Usual data values in an interface can be used to explain what?
What is a variation of black-boxing testing?

context: The practice of <a0_0><b4_0>component interface testing<b4_0/><a0_0/> can be used to check the handling of data passed between various units, or subsystem components, beyond full integration testing between those units. The data being passed can be considered as "<a1_0><b5_0>message packets<b5_0/><a1_0/>" and the range or data types can be checked, for data generated from one unit, and tested for validity before being passed into another unit. One option for interface testing is to <a2_0>keep a <b6_0>separate log file of data items being passed<a2_0/>, often with a timestamp logged to allow analysis of thousands of cases of data passed<b6_0/> between units for days or weeks. Tests can include checking the handling of some extreme data values while other interface variables are passed as normal values. Unusual data values in an interface can help explain <b7_0>unexpected performance in the next unit<b7_0/>. <a3_0><b8_0>Component interface testing<b8_0/><a3_0/> is a variation of black-box testing, with the focus on the data values beyond just the related actions of a subsystem component.
